question.content:
Element $\text A$ crystallises to form a cubic unit cell.

The mass of the unit cell is $1.024\times 10^{-21}$ $\text g$.

**If the edge length of the unit cell is $800$ $\text {pm}$, calculate the density of the element.**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] $\text {g cm}^{-3}$.

hints.content:
##Strategy

Let's use the value of edge length to calculate volume and use the information given to arrive to the value of density.

##Solution

Density of a unit cell,

$\begin{align}\goldE{\text d}&=\dfrac{\redE {\text M_\text u}}{{\purpleD {\text V_\text u}}}\end{align}$

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
$\redE{\text M_\text u}$ represents *mass of the unit cell*,

$\purpleD{\text V_\text u}$ represents *volume of the unit cell*.

hints.content:
Volume of the unit cell,

$\begin{align}\purpleD {\text V_\text u}&=\purpleD {\text a^3}\end{align}$

where $\purpleD {\text a}$  represents *edge length* of the unit cell.

Substituting the value of $\purpleD {\text V_\text u}$ in the formula of $\goldE {\text d}$ we get,

$\begin{align}\goldE {\text d}&=\dfrac{\redE {\text M_\text u}}{\purpleD {\text a^3}}\end{align}$

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.showPrompt: Substituting these values in the formula we get,

hints.content:
The density of element $\text A$ is

$2$ $\text {g cm}^{-3}$.
